node.title: Napier Art Deco Festival gives region 'much needed' economic boost
node.description: Organisers of Napier's Art Deco Festival are hailing this year's celebration as a success.

node.title: Marshall Islands looks to relax Hawaii quarantine, ramps up Covid-19 vaccines
node.description: The head of the Marshall Islands government's National Disaster Committee is hopeful the government will adopt a reduced quarantine policy for people coming to the islands starting next month.

node.title: Biden agrees "in principle" to meet with Putin
node.description: The White House says it would only happen if Russia doesn't invade Ukraine, and after one slated for this week between U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and his Russian counterpart.

node.title: Australia opens borders to all tourists again
node.description: Australia will welcome international tourists on Monday after nearly two years of sealing its borders, relying on high Covid-19 vaccination rates to live with the pandemic as infections decline.

node.title: Australian PM claims China aimed laser at defence plane
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says a Chinese military vessel shining a laser at an Australian maritime aircraft was an "act of intimidation" that put Defence Force lives at risk.

node.title: Luxon calls for easing of vaccine mandates after Omicron peak
node.description: National's leader Christopher Luxon is calling on the government to begin removing vaccine mandates once the country is through the peak of its Omicron outbreak.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 2365 new community cases, two deaths and 116 in hospital
node.description: The Ministry of Health is reporting 2365 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today.

node.title: Moana Pasifika may return for round two
node.description: The second round of Super Rugby Pacific has been reshuffled in New Zealand to give Moana Pasifika the best chance of being able to play their scheduled match against the Chiefs.

node.title: Chorus posts jump in net profit, interim dividend
node.description: Shareholders of telecommunications company Chorus are set for a bigger pay day as it scales back spending on ultra-fast broadband.

node.title: Rapid antigen tests rolled out to ease load on lab workers
node.description: Rapid antigen tests are being deployed across Auckland as lab crews struggle with increasing demand.

node.title: Cargo delays force New Zealand exporters to charter private ships
node.description: Lengthy cargo delays have forced New Zealand's key exporters to charter private ships to ferry meat and produce to foreign markets. Audio

node.title: Marlborough running out of land for housing - report
node.description: Predicted strong population growth within 10km of central Blenheim could see a shortfall of land for urban development within the next 30 years.

node.title: Trump readies return to social media
node.description: Donald Trump's new social media venture, Truth Social, appears set to launch in Apple's App Store on Monday, according to posts from an executive

node.title: Australia reopens to international travelers after nearly 2 years
node.description: Vaccinated travelers were greeted at Sydney's airport by jubilant well-wishers waving toy koalas and favorite Australian foods.

node.title: Majority wants no change, or increase to restrictions - survey
node.description: About half of New Zealanders surveyed think current Covid-19 restrictions are appropriate, with the rest split almost evenly between wanting fewer or more restrictions.

node.title: Strong 5.6 magnitude earthquake near Blenheim
node.description: The magnitude 5.6 earthquake near Blenheim was recorded about 4.06 pm by GeoNet.

node.title: Covid-19: Ill protesters urged to stay away from hospital
node.description: Wellington Hospital says any outbreak of Omicron at the protest outside Parliament will add stress to an already stretched emergency department. Audio

node.title: Support grows for petition demanding justice for attacked Otago teen
node.description: US model Bella Hadid has signed a petition seeking justice for a high school student whose hijab was forcibly removed. Audio

node.title: Property for Industry posts record annual result
node.description: The industrial property investment company expects buoyant market conditions to continue in 2022.

node.title: Onion season could end in tears
node.description: Country Life - An onion exporter estimates Europe will take just half the volume of New Zealand onions it usually sells this year. Audio

node.title: International demand growing for New Zealand wine
node.description: The country's wine industry says it "desperately" needs a bigger harvest this year to replenish stocks and keep up with international demand.

node.title: NZ Post courier business earnings grow over Christmas
node.description: NZ Post has had a record-breaking Christmas, with an average of nine parcels delivered every second.

node.title: Internet issues in Tonga pose challenge for workers trying to come to NZ
node.description: Poor internet access in Tonga because of last month's eruption and tsunami is putting massive pressure, stress and strain on seasonal workers trying to come to Aotearoa for the pipfruit harvest.

node.title: Black Fern leads Matatū leaders into Super Rugby Aupiki
node.description: Black Fern Alana Bremner will lead the South Island wāhine in the Super Rugby Aupiki competition surrounded by other strong leaders.

node.title: Freightways delivers $43.7m half-year profit
node.description: Information management, freight and courier business Freightways has reported a strong first half, despite challenges posed Covid-19 lockdowns.

node.title: Poll: More Americans would rather meet Lincoln than Washington
node.description: Lincoln is preferred across demographic groups.

node.title: Sarah Hirini to captain Hurricanes in Super Rugby Aupiki
node.description: Black Ferns Sevens gold medallist Sarah Hirini will captain the Hurricanes in the inaugural Super Rugby Aupiki competition.

node.title: City mourns Huntington Beach police officer who died in helicopter crash
node.description: Dive teams had been in the water all day searching for clues about what caused the helicopter to crash just feet from the busy shore.

node.title: Some of biggest firms' earnings expected to show tough results
node.description: The floodgates of company earnings open this week, with close to 30 companies set to report, and some of the numbers from some of the biggest companies may be tough reading.

node.title: Hospitality in crisis due to lack of domestic travel
node.description: Hospitality New Zealand says domestic travel is at a standstill with forward bookings pointing to accommodation occupancy rates as low as 20 percent for the next three months.
